paper_title.ja: デジタル画像相関法を用いた光重合型コンポジットレジンの収縮変位場評価
paper_title.en: Evaluation of Shrinkage Displacement Fields in Light Cure Composite Resin by Digital Image Correlation Method

description.ja: A digital image correlation method was applied to study the polymerization shrinkage of a light cure resin composite in cavities of bovine teeth. A cylindrical cavity prepared using a bonding agent was employed to measure the shrinkage behavior on the top free surface of the cavity. A semi-cylindrical cavity was also used to simulate the cross section of the cylindrical cavity. The resin filled in the cavity was irradiated using a visible-light curing unit and photographed with a CCD camera as a function of time. The cavities prepared without the bonding agent were employed to study the bonding strength at the interface between the resin and tooth substrate, and the following results were obtained. The shrinkage behavior was largely different in the cavities prepared with and without the bonding agent. With the bonding agent, the displacement distribution was continuous at the interface, and its absolute value exhibited the maximum in the resin close to the interface and the minimum near the center of the cavity. Without the bonding agent, there existed the interface which exhibited the discontinuous distribution, and the discontinuity tended to initiate and grow locally at the interface.
description.en: A digital image correlation method was applied to study the polymerization shrinkage of a light cure resin composite in cavities of bovine teeth. A cylindrical cavity prepared using a bonding agent was employed to measure the shrinkage behavior on the top free surface of the cavity. A semi-cylindrical cavity was also used to simulate the cross section of the cylindrical cavity. The resin filled in the cavity was irradiated using a visible-light curing unit and photographed with a CCD camera as a function of time. The cavities prepared without the bonding agent were employed to study the bonding strength at the interface between the resin and tooth substrate, and the following results were obtained. The shrinkage behavior was largely different in the cavities prepared with and without the bonding agent. With the bonding agent, the displacement distribution was continuous at the interface, and its absolute value exhibited the maximum in the resin close to the interface and the minimum near the center of the cavity. Without the bonding agent, there existed the interface which exhibited the discontinuous distribution, and the discontinuity tended to initiate and grow locally at the interface.

paper_title.en: Dynamic effect on impact tensile fracture behavior of PMMA resin

description.en: The fracture behavior of a brittle polymer, polymethyl methacrylate (PMMA) resin, under static and impact tensile loadings was studied using single-edge-cracked specimens. The impact load and displacement were measured with a Piezo sensor and a high-speed extensometer, respectively. The load and displacement diagram, i.e., the external work Uex applied to the specimen was used to determine the elastic energy Ee and non-elastic energy En due to viscoelastic and plastic deformation, and the fracture energy Ef for creating new fracture surface As. The energy-release rate was then estimated using Gf = E f/As. The values of Ee, En, E f and Gf were correlated with the fracture loads, and the two results determined for the static and impact loadings were compared to study the effect of loading conditions. ©2008 The Society of Materials Science.

publication_name.en: Zairyo/Journal of the Society of Materials Science, Japan

paper_title.ja: Experimental analysis of thermal displacement and strain distributions in a small outline J-leaded electronic package by using wedged-glass phase-shifting moiré interferometry
paper_title.en: Experimental analysis of thermal displacement and strain distributions in a small outline J-leaded electronic package by using wedged-glass phase-shifting moire interferometry

description.en: TO evaluate the influence of a printed wiring board (PWB) with a high coefficients of thermal expansion (CTE) on the thermal deformation of a small outline J-leaded electronic package (SOJ), a newly developed phase-shifting method was applied to moire interferometry. This phase-shifting moire interferometry method uses a wedged glass plate as a phase shifter to obtain displacement fields with a sensitivity of 100nm/line. This technique also enabled the quantitative determination of strain distributions in all observation areas. Thermal loading was applied from room temperature (25 degrees C) to an elevated temperature (100 degrees C), and then the thermal strains of SOJ with and without the PWB were compared. The results showed that the concentrations of the longitudinal strains epsilon(xx) and epsilon(yy) became increasingly prominent when mounted on the PWB, and the shear strains gamma(xy) were concentrated at the corners of the silicon chip. The values of these strains increased by about 50% when the SOJ was mounted on the PWB. (c) 2007 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Tensile Fracture Behavior of Polymethyl Methacrylate (PMMA) under Impact Loading Conditions
paper_title.en: Tensile Fracture Behavior of Polymethyl Methacrylate (PMMA) under Impact Loading Conditions

description.ja: The fracture behavior of a brittle polymer, polymethyl methacrylate (PMMA) resin, under impact tensile loading was studied using single-edge-cracked specimens. The dynamic load and displacement were measured with a Piezo sensor and a high-speed extensometer, respectively. The load and displacement diagram, i.e., the external work Uex applied to the specimen was used to determine the elastic energy Ee and non-elastic energy En due to viscoelastic and plastic deformation, and the fracture energy Ef for creating new fracture surface As. The energy-release rate was then estimated using Gf=Ef/As. The values of Ee, En, Ef and Gf were correlated with the fracture loads, and compared with the ones earlier determined for the static loading conditions.
description.en: The fracture behavior of a brittle polymer, polymethyl methacrylate (PMMA) resin, under impact tensile loading was studied using single-edge-cracked specimens. The dynamic load and displacement were measured with a Piezo sensor and a high-speed extensometer, respectively. The load and displacement diagram, i.e., the external work Uex applied to the specimen was used to determine the elastic energy Ee and non-elastic energy En due to viscoelastic and plastic deformation, and the fracture energy Ef for creating new fracture surface As. The energy-release rate was then estimated using Gf=Ef/As. The values of Ee, En, Ef and Gf were correlated with the fracture loads, and compared with the ones earlier determined for the static loading conditions.

paper_title.en: Loading Effect on Brittle Fracture of Epoxy Resin

description.ja: The fracture behavior of a thermosetting polymer, epoxy resin, under the effect of static and impact tensile loading was studied using single-edge-cracked specimens. The static and dynamic loads were determined using a load cell and a piezo sensor, respectively, and the displacement of the specimen was measured using a high-speed extensometer. From the load-displacement diagram, the external work (Uex) applied to the specimen was used to evaluate the elastic energy (Ee) and nonelastic energy (En) due to viscoelastic and plastic deformation, and the fracture energy (Ef) for creating a new fracture surface (As). The energy release rate was then estimated using Gf = Ef⁄As, and the values of Gf were correlated with the fracture load (Pc). The result indicated that although Gf increased with Pc for both tests, the impact test showed much lower values than the static test.
description.en: The fracture behavior of a thermosetting polymer, epoxy resin, under the effect of static and impact tensile loading was studied using single-edge-cracked specimens. The static and dynamic loads were determined using a load cell and a piezo sensor, respectively, and the displacement of the specimen was measured using a high-speed extensometer. From the load-displacement diagram, the external work (Uex) applied to the specimen was used to evaluate the elastic energy (Ee) and nonelastic energy (En) due to viscoelastic and plastic deformation, and the fracture energy (Ef) for creating a new fracture surface (As). The energy release rate was then estimated using Gf = Ef⁄As, and the values of Gf were correlated with the fracture load (Pc). The result indicated that although Gf increased with Pc for both tests, the impact test showed much lower values than the static test.

paper_title.en: Unsteady dynamic crack propagation in a brittle polymer

description.en: Dynamic crack propagation in a brittle polymer, poly(methyl-methacrylate) (PMMA), was studied using the method of caustics in combination with a Cranz-Schardin high-speed camera. Four different types of specimen geometry and loading method were employed to achieve the crack acceleration, deceleration, and/or reacceleration processes in one fracture event. The dynamic stress intensity factor K (ID) and crack velocity were obtained in the course of the crack propagation and the corresponding relationship was determined. The effect of the crack acceleration and deceleration on the K (ID)-velocity relationships was as follows: (1) the variations of K (ID) and the velocity were strongly influenced by the specimen geometry and loading method; (2) the velocity change was qualitatively in accord with K (ID); (3) K (ID) for a constant crack velocity was larger when the crack decelerated than it was when the crack accelerated or reaccelerated; (4) K (ID) for an acceleration-free crack was uniquely related to the velocity; and (5) K (ID) could be expressed as two parametric functions of the velocity and acceleration.

paper_title.en: Effect of rubber particle size on the impact tensile fracture behavior of MBS resin with a bimodal particle size distribution

description.en: We performed impact tensile fracture experiments on methylmethacrylate-butadiene-styrene (MBS) resin with small and large particles in a bimodal size distribution, and examined the effects of particle size on fracture behavior by fixing the total rubber content (28 wt%) and the small particle size (about 140 nm), and varying the size of large particles (about 490 nm or 670 nm). Dynamic load P' and displacement delta' of single-edge-cracked specimens were measured using a Piezo sensor and a high-speed extensometer, respectively. A P'-delta' diagram was used to determine external work U-ex applied to the specimen, elastic energy E-e stored in the specimen, and fracture energy E-f for creating a new fracture surface A(s). Energy release rate was then estimated using G (f) = E (f)/A (s). Values of G(f) were correlated with fracture loads and mean crack velocity v (m) determined from load and time relationships. We then examined the effect of particle size on G(f) and v(m), and results indicated that particle size plays an important role in changing the values of G(f) and v(m).

paper_title.en: Fracture micromechanisms of bioabsorbable PLLA/PCL polymer blends

description.en: Poly(L-lactide) (PLLA) has actively been used as a biomaterial for resorbable bone fixation devices for use in orthopedic and oral surgeries. Recently, in order to improve the fracture properties of brittle PLLA, polymer blends of PLLA and a ductile bioabsorbable polymer, poly(epsilon-caprolactone) (PCL), have been developed. The aim of the present study is to elucidate details of the fracture behavior and toughening mechanisms of PLLA/PCL blends. PLLA/PCL blends with different PCL contents were developed, and the critical energy release rate at crack initiation, G(in), was then measured to assess the effect of PCL content. It was shown that G(in) is dramatically improved by blending PCL with PLLA, and the maximum 51% of increase of G(in) is acheived with 5 wt% of PCL. Polarizing optical microscopy (POM) and scanning electron microscopy (SEM) of crack growth behavior were also performed to characterize the fracture mechanism. PLLA/PCL showed multiple craze formation in the crack-tip region, and elongated fibrils and voids construct the crazes. SEM of fracture surface also indicated that stretched fibril structures are formed on the surface as a result of elongation of PCL spherulites under high tensile stress condition in the crack-tip region. Thus, these damage formations are considered to be the primary energy dissipation mechanisms that resulted in the improvement of fracture energy. (C) 2006 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Measuring fracture energy in a brittle polymeric material: Application of a high-speed optical extensometer

description.en: The brittle fracture of polymethyl methacrylate (PMMA) was studied using a high-speed extensometer, which consisted of an optical fiber and a position-sensing detector (PSD). Single-edge-cracked tensile specimens were pin-loaded with a special jig so that they could split and fly in the loading direction after fracture. The flying height and residual deformation of the split specimen were measured to estimate the elastic energy E(e) and non-elastic energy E(n), respectively. By subtracting E(e) and E(n) from the external work U(ex) applied to the specimen, the fracture energy E(f) for creating a new fracture surface was evaluated. The results showed that E(e), E(n), and E (f) increased with U(ex), and the ratio E(f)/U(ex) was about 45% over a wide range of U(ex). Energy release rate was also estimated using U(ex) or E(f), and the results suggested that it was overestimated if E(e) and E(n) were included.

paper_title.en: Dynamic contact behavior of a golf ball during oblique impact: Effect of friction between the ball and target

description.en: The oblique impact between a golf ball and a polymethyl methacrylate (PMMA) target with smooth transparent surfaces was studied using a high-speed video camera. Video images of the impact were recorded from the backside of the target and were used to determine the contact time, contact area, and the displacement and rotation of the ball along the target. The average tangential and angular velocities were determined as functions of the inbound ball velocity. As the inbound ball velocity increased, the contact area and average tangential and angular velocities also increased while the contact time decreased. An oiled PMMA target was used to study the effect of reduced friction between the ball and target. The results were compared with earlier data for a steel target with relatively rough surfaces. The contact area and time were unaffected by friction, but the average tangential velocity increased while the average angular velocity decreased as the friction decreased.

paper_title.en: High-sensitivity measurement of thermal deformation in a stacked multichip package

description.en: The thermal deformation of a stacked multichip package, which is a newly developed electronic package, was measured by phase-shifting moire interferometry. We developed this method using a wedged glass plate as a phase shifter to obtain displacement fields having a sensitivity of 30 nm/line. This method also enabled the quantitative determination of the strain distributions in all observation areas. Thermal loading was applied from room temperature (25 degrees C) to elevated temperatures of 75 degrees C and 100 degrees C where the thermal strains were examined and compared. The results showed that the longitudinal strain epsilon(xx) was concentrated at the ends of two silicon chips, and the longitudinal strain epsilon(yy) increased between the two silicon chips. The shear strain gamma(xy) increased at the end of the lower silicon chip from 0.17% to 0.30% when the temperature increased by 25 degrees C.

research_project_title.ja: X線CTによるヒト生体歯周組織の変形計測と評価法に関する研究

description.ja: 咬合機能すなわち顎口腔系の力学的機能を調べることは咀嚼能力を知る上で重要な指標となります．そのため歯に作用する咬合力および歯の動態と変位に関する研究が種々の見地からなされていますが，ヒト生体歯と歯周組織変位場を全視野的な計測例はこれまでに見当たりません．本研究の目的は，歯顎顔面用コーンビームX線CTを使用して，ヒト生体歯周組織の変形を定量的に計測することです．実験では，咬合力計測とCT撮影を同時に行い，咬合力を負荷しない状態で１回目のCT撮影を，咬合力を負荷させた状態で２回目を撮影し，両者の３次元画像と座標変換法を応用することにより歯と歯周組織の変位計測を試みています．

research_project_title.ja: 光重合型コンポジットレジンの収縮変形に関する研究

description.ja: 光重合型コンポジットレジンは，審美性，操作性に優れるだけでなく，健全歯質の保全の観点からも最適な修復治療が可能な材料です．そのため臨床で広く用いられる充填材料となっており，その需要はさらに拡大しつつあります．しかし，レジンは硬化する際に重合収縮を生じるため，レジンや歯質および接着界面に応力が発生し，き裂や剥離などの欠陥の原因となることがあります．欠陥があるとそこから二次う蝕が進行するため，重合収縮の挙動を解明し，その挙動に応じた新規レジンの開発や臨床での対応策を図ることが必要です．本研究では，デジタル画像相関法を用いて，レジンの収縮変位を全視野で計測しています．より臨床に近い条件で収縮挙動を観察するために，牛歯の空孔にレジンを充填し，光照射による自由表面での収縮変形の可視化と変位を定量的に解析しています．さらにマイクロフォーカスX線CTを用い，空孔内部の可視化を進めています．

research_project_title.ja: 高分子および高分子系複合材料の力学特性に関する研究

description.ja: 高分子および高分子系複合材料の力学特性は，材料の微視的構造ならびに内部で発生する微視的損傷と密接な関係があります．本研究では研究室で独自に開発した種々の計測装置を応用することにより材料の力学特性を評価するとともに，材料の微視的変形や損傷を調べることにより，破壊メカニズムの解明を試みています．また力学的に優れる材料の開発を目的として，企業との共同研究も進めています．

research_project_title.ja: 人工歯根膜機能を有する新規インプラントの開発研究

description.ja: 現在のインプラントは，顎骨との強固な結合が得られる反面，可動性に乏しく，歯槽骨内で応力集中が生じやすいという欠点があります．そのため骨の破壊強度を下回る荷重でも長期間，繰返し負荷されると，骨の生理的負担能力を超えて，歯槽骨を損傷する恐れがあります．本研究は，天然歯のような感覚を有し，かつ安全性の高いインプラントの開発を最終目的としています．インプラントに咀嚼力の調節機能と感知機能を付与させるため，①人工歯根膜，すなわち圧電性高分子を緩衝材およびセンサーとしてインプラント内部に挿入する．②天然歯の咬合力に対する力学応答を高分子が模擬できるようにする．③咬合力に応じて高分子から微弱電流を発生させる．④微弱電流を歯肉や歯槽骨に存在する神経に伝える．以上により，インプラントに作用する咬合力を知覚できるばかりでなく，天然歯と同様に感知できるようにすることが開発の目的です．（特開2008-272322(P2008-272322A)・インプラント・新川和夫・国立大学法人九州大学
